feed.title: Google Cloud: Secure Source Manager
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Secure Source Manager

entry.content: You can now connect to Secure Source Manager using Developer Connect.
entry.summary: Developer Connect now supports connections to Secure Source Manager. This integration allows you to seamlessly connect your development environment to your private code repositories.
entry.title: Feature: Connect to Secure Source Manager

entry.content: You can now assign custom domains for your private Secure Source Manager instance's HTML, API, Git HTTP, and Git SSH endpoints. To use custom domains, you must provide your own Certificate Authority (CA) certificate and CA pool during instance creation. You can only create custom domains using the API when you first create an instance. For more information, see Create a Private Service Connect Secure Source Manager instance.
entry.summary: You can now assign custom domains for your private Secure Source Manager instance's endpoints. This requires providing your own Certificate Authority (CA) certificate and CA pool during instance creation. Custom domains can only be configured using the API when you first create an instance.
entry.title: Feature: Custom domains for Secure Source Manager

entry.content:
Secure Source Manager is now available in the following regions:

  • us-east1 (South Carolina)
entry.summary: Secure Source Manager is now available in us-east1 (South Carolina). This feature provides a secure and managed environment for your source code repositories. Check the documentation for a full list of supported regions.
entry.title: Feature: Secure Source Manager Now Available

entry.content: Secure Source Manager is compliant with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), and is also FedRAMP High compliant.
entry.summary: Secure Source Manager is compliant with HIPAA.
entry.title: Announcement: Secure Source Manager HIPAA Compliant

entry.content: You can now use a Google-managed certificate when you create a create a Private Service Connect Secure Source Manager instance.
entry.summary: Use a Google-managed certificate for Private Service Connect Secure Source Manager instances.
entry.title: Feature: New feature: Google-managed certificates for Private Service Connect

entry.content: Integrated data loss prevention (DLP) is now generally available
entry.summary: Integrated data loss prevention is now generally available.
entry.title: Changed: Data Loss Prevention Now Available

entry.content: Secure Source Manager is now generally available for all customers.
entry.summary: Secure Source Manager is now available for all customers.
entry.title: Announcement: Secure Source Manager now available

entry.content:
Secure Source Manager is now available in the following regions:

  • australia-southeast1 (Sydney)
  • asia-northeast1 (Tokyo)
entry.summary: Secure Source Manager is now available in australia-southeast1 (Sydney) and asia-northeast1 (Tokyo).
entry.title: Changed: Secure Source Manager now in more available
